intro: Argythamnia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. The fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts upon maturity.
